name: Rotini Chicken Salad
author: nascar3
summary: Terrific lunchtime or picnic salad, hearty enough to be a meal!
directions: Fill a pot with lightly-salted water and bring to a boil
Cook the chicken breast in the boiling water until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the chicken breast should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
Cut the breast into cubes and spread in a single layer on a plate; place chicken in refrigerator for 1 hour, or until completely cooled
Fill a pot with lightly-salted water and bring to a boil
Stir the pasta into the boiling water; cook until the pasta has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes
Drain, and rinse thoroughly with cold water to cool
Stir the celery, Parmesan cheese, green onions, mayonnaise, sour cream, milk, parsley, basil, and thyme together in a large bowl
Fold the chicken, rotini, and peas into the mayonnaise mixture
